inclusion.criterion: an audiogram performed as standard of care for evaluation and management of chronic tinnitus
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the drug used in this investigation will be 5% lidocaine patches (Endo Pharmaceuticals and Actavis Pharmaceuticals)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: study drug will be prescribed by a physician in the Department of the Otolaryngology at UC Davis, to be filled at the pharmacy of the participant's choosing
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the transdermal lidocaine patches will be administered to the participant's torso, either the upper back or chest, at his or her preference
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: all relevant patient information including symptoms checklists, results of TFI, and other important patient care information will be recorded in the UC Davis Electronic Medical Record (EMR) for each encounter under the appropriate encounter subheading
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient data will also be transposed into a REDCap database for patient tracking, evaluation, and analysis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: each individual will be asked to complete the tinnitus functional index
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the results of the TFI and the symptom checklist will be recorded into the participant's health record
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: each participant will be prescribed thirty transdermal lidocaine patches, so that one patch can be applied daily for 12 hours, as indicated by the manufacturer
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the participant will be asked to follow-up in 4 weeks by phone
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous exposure to lidocaine as a treatment for tinnitus
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Taking medications, herbal remedies and supplements that may interact with lidocaine, including but not limited to antivirals, benzodiazepines, and St. John's Wart
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 15-year-old boy with asthma diagnosed a year ago. He presents with shortness of breath, chest tightening and cough.
